greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows where T(n,k) is the number of integer partitions of n > 0 with runs-resistance k, 0 <= k <= n - 1.
comment: For the operation of taking the sequence of run-lengths of a finite sequence, runs-resistance is defined as the number of applications required to reach a singleton.
link: Claude Lenormand, Deux transformations sur les mots, Preprint, 5 pages, Nov 17 2003.
example: Row n = 8 counts the following partitions:
xref: A similar invariant is frequency depth; see A323014, A325280.
The version for compositions is A329744.
The version for binary words is A329767.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Nov 21 2019
